attributes.action: Parliament should request John Bercow publicly apologize for his Trump remarks
attributes.background:
John Bercow publicly insulted Trump and said he was "strongly opposed to an address by President Trump in Westminster Hall".

His comments are embarrassing to the British people and also in breech of parliamentary rules as he should remain impartial. 

The people deserve a public apology.

rejection.details:
Issuing an apology is the personal decision of the Speaker, and is therefore not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament.  

If you like, you could sign the petition below, which asks the House of Commons to debate a vote of no confidence in the Speaker:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/183279
